briefdescription.para: No icon is used.
A cross is used to highlight points (+)
A cross is used to highlight points (x)
A box is used to highlight points (□)
A circle is used to highlight points (○)
A full box is used to highlight points (■)
A diamond is used to highlight points (◇)
A diamond is used to highlight points (◆)
Icons.
The size of the icon for points.
Icon to be shown.
Nested lists used for multitypes.
Creates a new RubberBand.

parameterdescription.para: The map canvas to draw onto. Its CRS will be used to map points onto screen coordinates. The ownership is transferred to this canvas.
Defines how the data should be drawn onto the screen. QgsWkbTypes::LineGeometry, QgsWkbTypes::PolygonGeometry or QgsWkbTypes::PointGeometry

briefdescription.para: Adds the geometry of an existing feature to a rubberband This is useful for multi feature highlighting.

detaileddescription.para: As of 2.0, this method does not change the GeometryType any more. You need to set the GeometryType of the rubberband explicitly by calling reset() or setToGeometry() with appropriate arguments. setToGeometry() is also to be preferred for backwards-compatibility.

parameterdescription.para: the geometry object. Will be treated as a collection of vertices.
the layer containing the feature, used for coord transformation to map crs. In case of 0 pointer, the coordinates are not going to be transformed.

briefdescription.para: Adds a geometry to the rubberband.

detaileddescription.para: If crs is specified, the geometry will be automatically reprojected from crs to the canvas CRS.

briefdescription.para: Adds a vertex to the rubberband and update canvas.

detaileddescription.para:
The rendering of the vertex depends on the current GeometryType and icon. If adding more points consider using update=false for better performance
p
The vertex/point to add
doUpdate
Should the map canvas be updated immediately?
geometryIndex
The index of the feature part (in case of multipart geometries)

briefdescription.para: Returns the rubberband as a Geometry.

simplesect.para: A geometry object which reflects the current state of the rubberband.

briefdescription.para: Ensures that a polygon geometry is closed and that the last vertex equals the first vertex.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to update the map canvas immediately
index of the feature part (in case of multipart geometries)

briefdescription.para: Returns the current fill color.
Returns a vertex.

parameterdescription.para: The geometry index
The vertex index within geometry i

briefdescription.para: Returns the current icon type to highlight point geometries.
Returns the current icon size of the point icons.
Moves the rubber band point specified by index.

detaileddescription.para: Note that if the rubber band is not used to track the last mouse position, the first point of the rubber band has two vertices

briefdescription.para: Moves the rubber band point specified by index.

detaileddescription.para: Note that if the rubber band is not used to track the last mouse position, the first point of the rubber band has two vertices

briefdescription.para: Returns count of vertices in all lists of mPoint.
Returns number of vertices in feature part.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the feature part (in case of multipart geometries)

briefdescription.para: Removes the last point.

detaileddescription.para: Most useful in connection with undo operations

briefdescription.para: Removes a vertex from the rubberband and (optionally) updates canvas.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the vertex/point to remove, negative indexes start at end
Should the map canvas be updated immediately?
The index of the feature part (in case of multipart geometries)

briefdescription.para: Clears all the geometries in this rubberband.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets the representation type according to geometryType.
geometryType
Defines how the data should be drawn onto the screen. (Use Qgis::Line, Qgis::Polygon or Qgis::Point)

briefdescription.para: Returns the current secondary stroke color.
Sets the style of the brush.
Sets the color for the rubberband.

detaileddescription.para:
Shorthand method to set fill and stroke color with a single call.
color
The color used to render this rubberband

briefdescription.para: Sets the fill color for the rubberband.

parameterdescription.para: The color used to render this rubberband

briefdescription.para: Sets the icon type to highlight point geometries.

parameterdescription.para: The icon to visualize point geometries

briefdescription.para: Sets the size of the point icons.
Sets the style of the line.
Sets a secondary stroke color for the rubberband which will be drawn under the main stroke color.

detaileddescription.para:
Set to an invalid color to avoid drawing the secondary stroke.
color
The color used to render a secondary stroke color to this rubberband
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Sets the stroke color for the rubberband.

parameterdescription.para: The color used to render this rubberband

briefdescription.para: Sets this rubber band to a map canvas rectangle.

parameterdescription.para: rectangle in canvas coordinates

briefdescription.para: Sets this rubber band to geom.

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful for feature highlighting. In contrast to addGeometry(), this method does also change the geometry type of the rubberband.
geom
the geometry object
layer
the layer containing the feature, used for coord transformation to map crs. In case of 0 pointer, the coordinates are not going to be transformed.

briefdescription.para: Sets this rubber band to geometry.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to addGeometry(), this method does also change the geometry type of the rubberband. The coordinate reference system of the geometry can be specified with crs. If an invalid crs is passed, the geometry will not be reprojected and needs to be in canvas crs already. By default, no reprojection is done.

briefdescription.para: Adds translation to original coordinates (all in map coordinates)

parameterdescription.para: x translation
y translation

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of the line.

detaileddescription.para:
Stroke width for polygon.
width
The width for any lines painted for this rubberband

briefdescription.para: Returns number of geometries.
Returns the current stroke color.
called on changed extent or resize event to update position of the item
Returns the current width of the line or stroke width for polygon.
Draws shape of the rubber band.

parameterdescription.para: The QPainter object
A list of points used to draw the shape

briefdescription.para: Paints the rubber band in response to an update event.

parameterdescription.para: The QPainter object

briefdescription.para: Recalculates needed rectangle.

detaileddescription.para: The QgsRubberBand class provides a transparent overlay widget for tracking the mouse while drawing polylines or polygons.
